title: How to Make Cupcake Kabobs

steps.headline: Dip the marshmallows in water.
steps.description: The water will work as an adhesive for the sprinkles. Do this on both sides.

steps.headline: Dip the marshmallow in the sprinkles on both sides.
steps.description: As you can see here, different colors have been added to each end of the marshmallow for the best effect.

steps.headline: Be sure to get both sides, and handle the marshmallow with care once it's covered.
Assemble the cupcake kabobs.
steps.description: Slide on the cupcakes, fruit pieces and marshmallows in any order you choose. Go crazy or follow a pre-designed pattern. Either way, the end result will look delicious!

steps.headline: Hold the first kabob up to check its balance.
steps.description: Adjust if needed (for example, if it feels too top heavy, rearrange the pieces a little). Use this to inform the addition of the food pieces for the remaining cupcake kabobs.

steps.headline: Place onto suitable plates for serving.
steps.description: Here, a Fourth of July themed plate has been used to serve as a complementary background. Enjoy!

text: Adding Sprinkles to the Marshmallows Dip the marshmallows in water. The water will work as an adhesive for the sprinkles. Do this on both sides. Dip the marshmallow in the sprinkles on both sides. As you can see here, different colors have been added to each end of the marshmallow for the best effect. Be sure to get both sides, and handle the marshmallow with care once it's covered.  Assembling the Cupcake Kabobs Assemble the cupcake kabobs. Slide on the cupcakes, fruit pieces and marshmallows in any order you choose. Go crazy or follow a pre-designed pattern. Either way, the end result will look delicious! Hold the first kabob up to check its balance. Adjust if needed (for example, if it feels too top heavy, rearrange the pieces a little). Use this to inform the addition of the food pieces for the remaining cupcake kabobs. Place onto suitable plates for serving. Here, a Fourth of July themed plate has been used to serve as a complementary background. Enjoy!
